qas.question: What year was the Opium war?
What is another name for Xiamen?
What port became one of the major treaty ports after the Opium War?
What dialect did western diplomats learn to communicate with the Hokkien speaking people in China?
After the 1940's and 1950's Opium War, what became a major treaty port?

plausible_answers.text: the political and economical center of the Hokkien-speaking region in China.

qas.question: What did Zhangzhou slowly develop into?
In the 1940's and 1950's what did Quanzhou use as its standard dialect?
In what year was South-East Asia war?

context: Hokkien originated from <a0_0><b9_0>Quanzhou<b9_0/><a0_0/>. After the Opium War in <a1_0><b8_0>1842<b8_0/><a1_0/>, <a3_0><b5_0>Xiamen<a3_0/> (<a2_0>Amoy<a2_0/>)<b5_0/> became one of the major treaty ports to be opened for trade with the outside world. From mid-19th century onwards, Xiamen slowly developed to become <b6_0>the political and economical center of the Hokkien-speaking region in China.<b6_0/> This caused Amoy dialect to gradually replace the position of dialect variants from Quanzhou and Zhangzhou. From mid-19th century until the end of World War II, western diplomats usually learned <a4_0>Amoy Hokkien<a4_0/> as the preferred dialect if they were to communicate with the Hokkien-speaking populace in China or South-East Asia. In the 1940s and 1950s, Taiwan also held <b7_0>Amoy Hokkien<b7_0/> as its standard and tended to incline itself towards Amoy dialect.
